info.name: Racky - VTEX Filters Testing
info.description:
Complete collection for testing VTEX product sync with filters (Phase 2 implementation)

**Setup Steps:**
1. Run Register/Login to get JWT token (auto-saved)
2. Get Workspaces and copy workspace_id to variables
3. Get Connections (or create new VTEX store)
4. Get Categories/Brands to see available filters
5. Sync products with desired filters
6. View synced products

**Required Variables:**
- vtex_account_name: Your VTEX account
- vtex_app_key: Your VTEX App Key
- vtex_app_token: Your VTEX App Token

variable.description: Your VTEX account name (e.g., 'mystore' from mystore.vtexcommercestable.com.br)
VTEX App Key from your account settings
VTEX App Token from your account settings
Job ID for async sync operations
VTEX Product ID for testing direct API calls
VTEX SKU ID for testing direct API calls

item.name: 1. Authentication

request.description: Register a new user account. JWT token is automatically saved to collection variables.
Login with existing user. JWT token is automatically saved.

item.description: Authentication endpoints to obtain JWT token

item.name: 2. Workspaces

exec: pm.test("Has at least one workspace", function () {

request.description: Get all workspaces for the authenticated user. The first workspace ID is automatically saved.

item.description: Get workspace information (required for workspace-scoped requests)

item.name: 3. VTEX Store Setup

exec: console.log("No VTEX connection found. Please create one first.");

request.description: Get all store connections for current workspace. VTEX connection ID is auto-saved if found.
Test VTEX credentials before creating the store connection. Make sure to set vtex_account_name, vtex_app_key, and vtex_app_token variables first.
Create a new VTEX store connection. Connection ID is automatically saved.

item.description: Setup and manage VTEX store connections

item.name: 4. VTEX Filters (NEW)

request.description: Fetch all available categories from VTEX catalog. Use the category IDs in sync filters.
Fetch all available brands from VTEX catalog. Use the brand IDs in sync filters.
Fetch categories WITH product counts. First time may take 30-60 seconds, then cached for 24h. Shows which categories have products.
Fetch brands WITH product counts. First time may take 30-60 seconds, then cached for 24h. Shows which brands have products.

item.description: New endpoints to fetch categories and brands for filtering (Phase 1)

item.name: 5. Product Sync with Filters (UPDATED)

request.description: Sync all active products without any filters. Default behavior: includeActive=true, includeInactive=false.
Sync both active AND inactive products (no category/brand filters).

exec: pm.test("Sync successful with category filter", function () {

request.description: Sync only products from specific categories. Replace category IDs with actual IDs from 'Get VTEX Categories' response.

exec: pm.test("Sync successful with brand filter", function () {

request.description: Sync only products from specific brands. Replace brand IDs with actual IDs from 'Get VTEX Brands' response.

exec: pm.test("Sync successful with all filters", function () {

request.description: Sync products with all filters combined: active status + specific categories + specific brands. Most restrictive sync.
Force sync: DELETE all existing products and re-import with filters. Use with caution!

item.description: Updated product sync endpoint with filter support (Phase 2). Now supports pagination and removes the 30-product limit!

ğŸ“Š Monitor async job progress. Shows real-time percentage, ETA, and batch-level progress. Call this repeatedly to watch progress.

query.description: Filter: all, waiting, active, completed, failed

request.description: ğŸ“‹ Get list of all sync jobs for current workspace. Shows job history with status, progress, and timestamps.
ğŸ¥ Check system health: queue status, RabbitMQ connection, database, and overall performance.

item.description: ğŸš€ UPDATED: Async product sync system with FILTER SUPPORT! Now supports same filters as sync endpoint: includeActive, includeInactive, categoryIds, brandIds. No timeout limits, background processing with progress monitoring. Processes thousands of products with 3 concurrent batches.

request.description: Get all synced products with pagination. Verify that filters were applied correctly.

request.description: Filter products to show only VTEX marketplace products.

item.name: 7. VTEX Direct API Calls (Debug)

exec: // Save first product ID for testing

request.description: Fetches product and SKU IDs directly from VTEX. Returns object with productId keys and SKU ID arrays as values.
Fetches complete product metadata. Check IsActive field here.
Fetches complete SKU details. Check IsActive field here.
Fetches SKU pricing information. May return 404 if no pricing configured. Check if App Key has Pricing API permissions.
Fetches SKU inventory levels across warehouses.

item.description: Direct VTEX API calls for debugging. These bypass Racky backend and call VTEX APIs directly. Use these to inspect actual VTEX response structure and diagnose sync issues.
